result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall A Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge. To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).  Any remaning balance upon release to Extended supervision shall be due immediately. Failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to count two, and consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for 201 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation, complete any treatment. Court suggests Trauma Informed Care.

**11-20-15/ Judge Carolina M Stark**      
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended to state that the defendant shall have NO CONTACT with Shekeena B., NO CONTACT with Darneesha P or with her children, under Wis. Stats. 973.049                               **

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, ammunition or holder.

Complete Batterers Intervention program.
Comply with DOC supervision fees.
Restitution set at zero.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.

supervisions.notes:
Court orders Extended Supervision be assigned to Mental Health Unit of DOC. 
***February 18, 2015, Judge Carolina .Stark, ORDER  commuting term of Extended Supervision to five (5) years.***

Provide  DNA sample, if not already provided.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

Pay court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge. To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to Extended supervision shall be due immediately. Failure to pay will result in an entry of a civil judgment.

Concurrent with: Concurrent to count one, and consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for 201 days.
Court advised the defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison.  The Defendant  will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Randall A Lee in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Defendant Randall A Lee in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty for Randy Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
State has complied with victim notification and no restitution is being requested. 
AS TO COUNT 1: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS, concurrent to COUNT 2 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 201 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 6 YEARS.  
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
AS TO COUNT 2: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS, concurrent to COUNT 1 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 201 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, ammunition or holder. 
- Court orders Extended Supervision be assigned to Mental Health Unit of the Department of Corrections. 
- Mental Health Evaluation, complete any treatment. Court suggests Trauma Informed Care. 
- Complete HSED or GED. 
- Complete Batters Intervention Program. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with paying Department of Correction Supervision fees. 
- Court prohibits contact with Shekeena B., Dareesha P. and her children during confinement and during Extended Supervision.
- Restitution is set at $0.
- DNA sample, if not already provided. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Randall A Lee in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Defendant Randall A Lee in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Plea and Sentencing. Case proceeds to Plea Hearing. 
AS TO COUNT  1 & 2:
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
AS TO COUNT 3: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 3 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
